Does anyone know when should we discuss rational on wrong layoffs? I mean during the group or individual consultations?
please clarify â€œwrongâ€
When do the individual consultations start. Would be good to have a chat with a real human about whatâ€™s going on
It depends, right? You could claim that the layoffs overall are doing more harm than good, and that the people in X team should go do Y - this will be collective consultation.
If you want to say that you specifically are wrongly targeted, this could be part of individual consultation.
My projects are still on the roadmap, and just a new designer being assigned to support them, hence the question of not needing the role and layoff!
After the collective consultation completes, individual consultation follows, where you'll be able to pick from options that the collective consultation achieved, or argue your own case.
I think there are a few areas like this
the process is far from ideal. As soon as we confirm the representatives, we should collect all the inputs / concerns / requests all people have and see how to move from there
my suggestion for now, is to document
Yeah sounds good.
Thank you

Yes - itâ€™s in the Employee Info Pack.
Yes they always have to do that, but where sometimes Iâ€™ve used legal before costs have increased as Iâ€™ve got them to do formal negotiations

what's the timeline of having to seek legal advice? do we wait for the collective consultation process to take place and then present their findings to our respective lawyers, or would we need to start early?

The usual legal advice is after the final consultation and package has been received. Thatâ€™s what meta is obliged to pay for. (450) 
Any other legal advice taken beforehand is on the individual.
What is the purpose of legal advice after the package has already been agreed?
Itâ€™s to see if the agreement we are entering with meta ,as per the layoff, is all good for us to sign. They go through the agreement and the legalese within to see if anythingâ€™s untoward.
(Thatâ€™s the standard process Iâ€™ve gone through before)
@276918117130388@lid can you give us the timeline from last april?
They also explain parts which you might have not understood - since they essentially work on your behalf
Thanks for clarifying. I wonder if thatâ€™s something LLM can do these days.

Ah. Let me try to remember. 
In April - we were told about layoffs around the 28th. 

After which reps were selected the consultation process started in may, taking the whole of May to the beginning of June. The biggest part of our negotiation was increasing garden leave period to August so that we could get the next vest + some medical costs. (Our bargaining power was limited due to size of people affected)

In June we got the first emails being told we were selected for layoffs. I am not sure there were individual consultations but by mid/end June the termination papers were sent and the 2 month garden leave began for people who signed them .  

In August people who did not get other meta jobs were officially let go (with final packages received) 

That was the rough timeline.
@276918117130388@lid what happened with people that were not selected but did not yet find a redeployment? Is that a case?
They would stay in the org and only after consultations, business can decide what to do with them

Yes - exactly. Did not see that was a case last time tbh. 
If you are not selected - you are not affected and your role is safe.
@276918117130388@lid Am I reading this right that you were able to extend the garden leave, from 4 to 8 weeks?
What rationale did you use to win the extra weeks/vest?
But on what grounds
Like you asked for it but how was it justified
I think it was based on previous layoffs. The nearest vesting cycle was given.
I understood that as the new notice period, in case officially in your contract it is just a month.
I understand this as garden leave and notice period run in parallel.

This is what someone told me but will do more reading over the weekend
15th of May

It is definitely possible. There are just 3 weeks between April 23rd when people are supposed to be let go and May 15th. It is a replica of what happened in June 2025. Asking for a 2 month garden leave is something we should push for.
I would also support asking got 2 month garden leave, as it would give those on a Skilled Worker visa an additional month to find a new role in UK
Ok so 3 weeks is not a lot
ğŸ¤”
people are proposed to let go  on April 23rd, though having 8 week notice period in your contract makes it look strange, because end-of-march plus two weeks definitely covers vesting date.
